fields.description:
hi--  not sure   I have user asking to enable story points in his project
I found information like this:  but I am very new to atlassian products and admin

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/settings-estimates-with-story-points-715263380.html#Settingsestimateswithstorypoints-Settingstorypointestimation

Okta/bizops  jira
Please advise. How I can "turn" this on for user

Thanks brian
fields.summary: Story Points Enabling in existing sprint

fields.description:
The scrum master, business analysts, and product owners prioritize and groom the backlog based on our team's anticipated velocity. In other words, they really focus on the stories that are going to make the cut. Unfortunately, there's no visual indicator of where that cut will be in the backlog view in Jira.

Today, we have to manually calculate where that line would be, or we have to open up a new sprint (using the simultaneous sprint feature).

Here are a few suggestions:
 # Display a line or highlighting/shading in the backlog between the Jira issues that would make the next sprint based on previous velocity
 # Display the total story points when you select multiple issues
 # Have an option to automatically select the top issues from your backlog based on previous velocity
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I would like a way to visualize what will be included in the next sprint in the backlog view so that I do not have to manually add story points

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Closing a sprint no longer places the uncompleted issues on the top of the backlog. Instead, remaining issues will be arranged based on their rank when the were first added to the sprint. This can cause some confusion, as issues may end up being mixed with other open issues.

h3. Suggested Solution

Would be nice to have the ability to select where to place the remaining issues on the backlog / next sprint. (top / bottom / based on rank)
fields.summary: Ability to select the position for remaining issues on sprint completion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a user JIRA I would like to have a better readability of the main issue content

h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to hide horizontally the fields that show on the right hand panel so that the main issue fields are better readable.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse the right hand panel fields horizontally for better readability

fields.description:
Hi Jira devs,

I'm using your products on daily basis and find Zephyr+Jira integration extremely useful. I'm using ZAPI to report tests results from CI system back to Zephyr. On top of that, I'm displaying the results in Jira dashboard using "Test Execution" gadget (https://zephyrdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=589892#TestMetrics(Gadgets)-test_execution). 

A feature that I'd really want to be in this gadget is the option to display test cycles based on their names (simple filtering). This is extremely needed when I want to run different test suites - showing their results on a single chart is very confusing, regarding different number of test cases and so on. If I could show, for example, test executions, grouped by Cycle, filter by cycle name "acceptance" in one chart, filter by cycle name "integration" in second chart - that would be awesome. The X axis would then show how test cycles of suites of same type were changing over time (new test cycles are always appended to the right).

Looking forward to your opinion.

Thanks!
fields.summary: "Test Executions" gadget is lacking filtering functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, in JIRA the board owners are owners of the board filter. If the JIRA Admin would like to have ownership of the board, they will have to edit the filter to gain ownership.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA to assign the board ownership to JIRA Administrator.

h3. Workaround 

If the JIRA Administrator would like to change the board owner, they can do so by following workaround:

# Agile -> Manage Boards -> All Boards -> find the board 
# Click on the three dots next to it, choose "Configure".
# On the "Configure (Board)" page, note the exact name of the "Saved Filter".
# type gg, then shared. JIRA should offer "Shared Filters".
# find the filter whose name you noted in step 3
# Click the cog wheel to the right and choose "Change owner".
# Set the new owner for the shared filter. This will automatically also change the ownership of the board.
fields.summary: Assign Board Ownership to JIRA Administrator

fields.description:
The activity log currently shows when related commits are merged in, great. 

The development panel shows any existing branches that have been created for a particular feature request, great. 

However, there is no way to see when a person branched off for the issue once the feature branch has been closed/deleted.  It seems logical that the activity log would show "John created branch XYZ at Date/Time". This would be very helpful to us.
fields.summary: Issue - Activity Log - Include when "Create a branch" is clicked

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Go to an agile board that is not using a simplified workflow
# Click on "Configure"
# Choose "Columns" in the "Configuration" menu on the left
# Click on the ? icon, under the Agile Simplified Workflow unavailable message.
# The link is broken redirecting to a page that do not exist any more.
* https://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-070/Using+Simplified+Workflow

Another one:
# Go to an agile board
# Click 'Board' >> Configure
# Click Estimation
# Click 'Read more about estimation and tracking'
#* It is taking to this broken documentation page: https://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-070/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking

*Expected Results:*
The link should redirect to the correct documentation.

*Actual Results:*
The link is redirecting to a page that do not exist any more.

*Workaround:*
Access the documentation link https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+JIRA+Agile+Simplified+Workflow.
For the second one: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking
fields.summary: Help Icon link broken - Using Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to order the Versions in the backlog for JIRA Agile.
I'm raising an improvement request, just as requested [Here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-135491]. The drag and drop sorting feature does not update the order of the versions, which would be a very useful functionality. 

Cheers,
Rodrigo Silva | Cloud Support
fields.summary: Ordering Versions on JIRA Agile

fields.description:
In the Option to Search Test Execution, displayed all the available test cases listed and there are some columns available to apply filters. When the user try to apply filter for Test Cycle Name and you select an option displayed a ZQL error (image attached) and the filter is not applied. Also when user apply the filter the option selected is moved to the first place and if you try to unselect the option and look again the option is selected again.
An additional suggestion for this tool is for this page of Search Test Execution give us availability to add more columns from the ticket for example with which  tickets are linked/related in order to have a better tracking of subtasks with test cases.
fields.summary: Zephyr Test Management Tool Issue

fields.description:
h3. Description

Customer wish to transition issue status to a specific status when a sprint is complete. Customer would like to configure JIRA to perform auto transition issue status from "Done" to "Review" when they complete the sprint.

 
h3. Suggestion
 * Provide customer the option to configure auto transition issue status when a sprint is complete.
fields.summary: Auto transition issue status when sprint is complete

fields.description:
It would be great if you could filter by epic while in Work Mode, in a similar fashion to how you can in plan mode (see screenshot).  

Yes, you can add swim lanes to group them together, but this messes with queue order, and also makes the board very bulky.  We could get by with the swim-lanes, if they at least gave better overview information on the swim lane header.  For example, it would be nice to be able to see the number of story points (estimation) in each column on the header.  It would also be nice to be able to set the order the epic swim lanes appear.
fields.summary: Epic Filtering in Board "Work Mode"

fields.description:
It would be really nice if we could view the subtask list of an Issue on the Issue Detail section of the JIRA Board even if that type is filtered out.

Currently, The Board filter is setup in such a way where things are all or nothing. So, if I want to setup a filter to only show a parent story, I create a filter for standard Issue types. 

This is great because it keep my team focused on the parent story and I am not searching around all of the subtasks. However, if there is a parent story I need to see more detail on, I now need to click into the detail screen because if I want to see it on the Issue Detail view, its blocked by the filter.

All in all, I feel this drives a cleaner more focused board, and allows us to get a good sense of any issues without having the leave the board screen.

thanks!
fields.summary: Allow subtasks to be seen in the Issue Detail view of the Agile Boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a board's filter is complex and allows for issues from other project sprints to potentially appear on the board, functionality granted by the manage sprints permission is often not available as expected. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for applying the manage sprints permission predictably in a way that is not dependent on the complexity of the board's filter query.
fields.summary: Predictably Apply Manage Sprint Permissions Regardless of Board Filter Complexity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Multiple user picker' field in JIRA allows to enter deactivated users. They don't appear in the dropdown, but you can just type the name and it will be saved. In other 'user picker' fields, you won't be allowed to save after you enter a user that is not active.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* 
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the *User Management* section and copy the username of any deactivated user. 
# In JIRA, go to a Service Desk project and click the *Create* button (It's easier to reproduce in Service Desk because it includes by default a 'multiple user picker')
# In the *Approvers* field, paste the username of the deactivated user. Nothing will show up in the dropdown, but the field won't complain. (This field is a 'multiple user picker' as you can see at *Cog icon > Issues > Custom fields*).
# After you click *Save*, that deactivated user will be accepted.

Note: if you have an existing project in SD, you can also reproduce it by clicking *Edit* on the top left corner and adding the username in the *Approvers* field.

h3. Expected Results
If the user you type is not in the dropdown menu, you'll see an error after you click *Save* and you won't be able to actually save it until you enter a valid username.

h3. Actual Results
You can enter any deactivated username and be able to save the issue correctly.
 
h3. Notes
This happens for any 'multiple user picker' in JIRA, not only in the *Approvers* field in Service Desk.
fields.summary: 'Multiple user picker' allows to enter deactivated users

fields.description:
A recent update for JIRA Cloud removed the *Attach Screenshot* action and dialog, in favor of a feature that allows screenshots to be attached by pasting images from the clipboard directly in to the issue details screen, using the paste hotkey appropriate for the OS (i.e. {{CTRL+V}} in Windows).

With the previous *Attach Screenshot* functionality, it was possible to paste images, via the modal dialog, directly from a Kanban or Scrum board view, by first selecting a card and then selecting the Attach Screenshot action (through one of several methods). This is no longer possible with the new functionality.
fields.summary: Restore the ability to attach screenshots from a Kanban or Scrum board view

fields.description:
My team is responsible for two software projects. I want to manage a single sprint for my team, including tickets from both projects. I have configured the sprint board to my liking, but it uses a query which specifies the two projects for which I am responsible.

I want this board to be the default board for both projects. The board is not visible in the 'Boards in this project' selector for either project. Any boards that I create which do target one of the two projects will automatically become the default board, which is even farther from what I would like.

I have only been able to get a board to display in the project board selector if it specifies exactly one project. This is less than ideal. The best I can currently do is to set up project links to the desired board for each project.
fields.summary: Allow single board to associate with multiple projects

fields.description:
Browser: Chrome (Version 40.0.2214.94 (64-bit))
JIRA: v6.4-OD-15-055

Problem: When using the agile board with the left menu collapsed, the Epics button will not always be clickable. See on the [screen-cast|http://screencast.com/t/0UG225ny] that at some point the mouse point is not a 'hand' anymore and then the Epic link is not clickable.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Epic button is not always clickable

fields.description:
As of now, the board drop-down in the sidebar lists all boards associated with the project alphabetically, and the first time you access a project with project centric navigation enabled you'll see the first board in this list. If you change the board and navigate away from the project centric view, the next time you return to the project, you'll see the last board you were viewing. I know this may not be the best in some scenarios and as of now, a 'default' board cannot be automated to show in the new project navigation upon selecting a specific project.

Instead of this behavior, the ability to select a specific Kanban or Scrum board to display every time upon selecting a project when having multiple boards associated with a project would be beneficial to some users.
fields.summary: Ability to Select a Default Board Amongst the New Project Centric Navigation

fields.description:
In the Backlog view, our team spends time not only ordering issues in the current sprint by rank, but also grouping them together by status (to match the swim lane groupings view in "Active Sprints").

It would be useful if the issues were by default grouped by status (like the swim lane view "turned" 90 degrees counter clockwise - done issues grouped first, "to do" issues grouped at the bottom), then by ranking within those status groupings.

We tried adjusting the "order by" clause of the filter query backing the board, but doing so disables Ranking altogether.
fields.summary: Group issues (with Ranking enabled) in Backlog and sprints by status, then rank

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Builds tab has always been available in the JIRA Projects Overview page when JIRA is connected to Bamboo via application links. Access to this tab is no longer available when the new JIRA Project Navigation is enabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a project from the projects menu, with the new project navigation enabled
# Review the list of tabs or menu available in the left navigation side bar

h3. Expected Results
A build tab should be available as in the project overview page

h3. Actual Results
No builds tab in the new project navigation

h3.Solution / Workaround
The builds tab is still accessible from the project overview page if the new project navigation is disabled. This can be disabled from the user Profile menu per user.
fields.summary: Builds tab not available in new Project Navigation in JIRA

fields.description:
I see it pop in for a second, and then it just says *Kanban Board.*

Customers have found this undesirable.
[^board_name.webm]
fields.summary: The project sidebar hides my kanban board name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When displaying a JIRA board view (e.g., Backlog or Active Sprints), I see two refreshes: an AJAX refresh of the data on screen and a refresh of the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a [HAR file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Generating+HAR+files+and+Analysing+Web+Requests] while accessing the following URL: 
{noformat}
<Base_URL>/secure/RapidStart.jspa
{noformat}
# Analyse the HAR file using any HAR file viewer. (for example: [Google HAR Analyzer|https://toolbox.googleapps.com/apps/har_analyzer/])

h3. Expected Results
No request with rapidViewId set to “undefined”.

h3. Actual Results
There is a request with rapidViewId set to “undefined”:
{noformat}
<Base_URL>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel?rapidViewId=undefined&_=1439564161380
{noformat}

h3. Note
* HAR file is attached for the problem.
fields.summary: Displaying a JIRA board view causes a double refresh

fields.description:
If my board filter uses the syntax "project in (PRJ1, PRJ2)", the board is listed in the JIRA 6.4 sidebar under the "Boards in this project" drop-down list.

If my filter instead uses the syntax "category = Myprojects", the boards are not visible.
If I use a sub-filter "project in (PRJ1, PRJ2)" and reference it using "filter = 12345 and..." it doesn't show up in the list either.

I don't see any good workaround, because when you have *dozens* of filters all based on the same "project group", having to manually change them one by one to modify the project list is just not usable.
fields.summary: Project sidebar does not list boards if the query uses the category field or a sub-filter

fields.description:
Updating this documentation to explain what will happen when issues from different projects are being added into a Sprint:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Working+with+Sprints
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver071/planning-sprints-800706719.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-project-permissions-802592442.html
fields.summary: Updating Sprints documentation

fields.description: In issue view page, the section issues in epic should have an issue count, it could be there on the title between brackets, like "Issues in epic (20)"
fields.summary: Issues in epic should show a count

fields.description:
There is a caveat that is given for any Workflow Trigger that is setup in JIRA:

_Caveats: Conditions, validators, and permissions will be ignored for automatic transitions but operate as usual for manual transitions._

For an Automatic Transition, according to the instructions, any Conditions,etc. set on Triggers will be ignored. This can sometimes be a problem, especially when a Condition is desired, since operations can occur (such as issue reopens), that are unwanted.
fields.summary: Allow workflow triggers to obey conditions, etc. for automatic transitions

fields.description:
To be quite honest, I was quite surprised to see that it is currently not possible to have BitBucket commit hashes autolinked / integrated into the Jira issues.

It this feature on the roadmap?
fields.summary: Ability to reference a BitBucket hash in Jira comments

fields.description:
I would like to add a condition on a DVCS trigger, specifically for Pull Requests being created / accepted on specific branches.  This is so we can perform transitions for tickets only when they are looking to be merged into "develop" or "hotfix" branches, not during incremental code reviews or integration PRs.  

Please see my question here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/29263153/how-do-you-trigger-a-workflow-triggers-on-a-pull-request-action-to-or-from-a-specific-branch
fields.summary: Support conditions on DVCS triggers

fields.description:
h3. Currently:
Current JIRA integration with Bitbucket (and I expect GitHub and/or other DVCSs) allows automatic linking of a JIRA issue with a git branch, provided the issue's key is included in the branch name. Commits are similarly linked if the commit message also includes the issue key, and the Development panel when viewing that issue provides direct links to those branches and/or commits. 

h3. Suggested:
As a user I would like to be able to *manually* link *one or more* arbitrarily-named branches (i.e. the branch does not need to have the issue key in its name) to an issue. This could occur in a way similar to linking JIRA issues, or an approach like Labels or Components.

h3. Example Use Case:
I tend to name branches with the issue key of an Epic or other large-effort issue. The related work may involve multiple JIRA issues, each of which should be linked to the branch. The reverse is also true -- a given Epic or other issue may pertain to (or at least have relevant information regarding) multiple branches, but those branches don't necessarily have _every_ related issue's key in their branch names.

As a workaround, I'm currently using a Custom Field to specify related branches on an issue, specifically a Labels field to try to minimize text discrepancies like typos. Duplicate values still do occur, however, since labels are case-sensitive (e.g. branch names "myfeature-KEY-123" and "myfeature-key-123" and "MyFeature-Key-123" are treated as distinct values). Possibly a drop-down selection (e.g. similar to Project Components) could be available for this field so that links are made to a pre-determined list of known existing branches, or some happy medium.
fields.summary: Ability to manually link an issue with multiple development branches

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users can connect JIRA to Bitbucket/GitHub. This allows them to show commits in JIRA issues and also Smart Commits to transition issues based on commit messages. It would be great if it could link JIRA issues to Bitbucket/GitHub issues as well.

h3. Suggestion
Allow users to link JIRA issues to Bitbucket/GitHub issues

Additionally, create a synchronization between these issues such that
* When an issue is created in github, a corresponding issue would be created in jira
* Any new comments in the github issue would propagate to the jira ticket
* Any new comments in the jira ticket would propagate to the github issue
* If the github issue was closed, the linked jira ticket would be closed
* If the jira ticket was closed, the linked github issue would be closed.
fields.summary: Link JIRA issues to DVCS issues

fields.description:
It is not clear in [the documentation for activity stream|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Activity+Stream+Gadget] which commits from repositories in DVCS accounts are shown.

It seems that only ones with smart commits linking to JIRA issues appear in activity stream.
fields.summary: Change activity stream documentation regarding repository commits

fields.description: As a user, when creating a branch via a JIRA ticket, I'd like to have the branch showing up on the development tools section, and also, I'd like to see a link to the issue on the branch created (just like what happens with smart commits).
fields.summary: Create a reciprocal link between JIRA and repository while creating a branch via JIRA ticket

fields.description:
h2.Summary
'Code Committed' condition doesn't work againt DVCS commits

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Make sure instance is connected to a repository via DVCS connector
# Create a test project and ticket. Edit workflow; set a transition condition with the 'Code Committed' condition. Code commits *must be* initiated before status can be transitioned. 
!Untitled.png|thumbnail!
# Commit changes to the test ticket.

h2.Expected Result
Status transition button doesn't appear even though code is already committed against the test ticket.

h2.Current Result
Status transition button doesn't appear even after the commit.
fields.summary: 'Code Committed' condition doesn't work againt DVCS commits

fields.description:
When doing a commit from bitbucket, the #time element is not putting in the logged time. This is a major issue, as it makes it difficult to invoice the client.

TSS-324 #close moved button to right, and used a element instead of button #time 15m 
TSS-322 #close made the date revert to original date when deselecting annual #time 30m

is an example of a commit message, which is not 100% working. It is however closing the issue and putting the comment in is working for both ticket.

Can you please urgently look into this. thanks
fields.summary: Time not logging after commits

fields.description: We would like to be able to use JQL to search for when Epic Links have been changed. Currently, Jira does not save the history of Epic Link changes so we are unable to use the CHANGED keyword.
fields.summary: Track Epic Link History

fields.description:
When I log on to the Dashboards, it reminds me of the following information:
You do not have permission to access /admin/users/browseusers.action. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.
fields.summary: I can not log in Dashboards

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA Cloud is isn't possible to change what appears in the 'Issues in Epic' panel in an epic screen.

The columns shown are the issue reference, issue summary, issue type and status.

I would like to be able to see other information in this screen, such as time tracking information (estimated & remaining) and other fields that can be filtered on.
fields.summary: Add facility to change what is displayed in the 'Issues in Epic' panel

fields.description:
Linking a project to a hg repository limited by branch is a debatable use case, and has no meaning for git.  To make them work the same we should remove all concept of branch filtering.

This includes but may not be limited to:
* When creating a repository, the "/default" branch is added to the url, remove this.
* When requesting a changeset list, the branch filtering should be removed
* Remove tracking of the branch in the RepositoryUrl as its no longer needed
* An upgrade task should be written to fix the project mappings and trigger a resync for each project/mapping
fields.summary: Remove branch filtering

fields.description:
The synchronizer uses BitbucketChangesetIterator to iterate over a lazy loaded changeset list.  It uses the revision field which is, at best, unreliable for hg and at worst, non-existent for git.

The BitbucketChangesetIterator (and BitbucketChangesetIterator) need to be rewritten to not use the revision number.  This will mean the iterator will work for both hg and git.
fields.summary: Update sync to work with git
Add oAuth authentication for private Github repositories
Get commits from all branches (not only from master) from Github repository
Migrate existing GitHub data from pluginSettings to the ActiveObjects

fields.description: In a first cut it should expose list of repositories and their current sync status.
fields.summary: Add Rest interface to the plugin
References to Repositories and ProjectMappings should be made by id

fields.description: Managing postcommit hooks (services) requires an admin password to the repository. We will need to store username and password and use it when removeving the repository.
fields.summary: Remove postcommit hook when repository is deleted

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to help an organization install and configure the JIRA GitHub plugin.  We ran into this problem:

{quote}
Whenever I try to set up a repository, I keep getting an error about
"XSRF Security Token Missing".  I have tried numerous times, and it
consistently fails for me.

The error page recommends I look at
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-20696 which I did.  But the
description does not seem to fit.  This is definitely not a time out
issue as I have even logged out, logged back in and immediately tried
to set this up.
{quote}

There is also a reoccurring stack trace in the logs that mentions fisheye, but I don't think that's related.  

Have you seen this before or do you have any ideas?  I'm not sure if I should talk to you as the developer of the plugin or perhaps some of the JIRA devs. 

Thanks,
Charles
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing

fields.description: Why has configurable automatic sync been removed in JIRA 6.4? Why only allow a user to manually sync to (my usecase) Github?
fields.summary: JIRA DVCS Git/Github Sync cannot be automated in 6.4

fields.description:
Using Jira OnDemand and the DVCS connector linked to github, when commits are made to the github repo with the description containing an issue key, the commits are not being added to the issue in JIRA.

When I go into the github webhooks, I can see the event that was sent to jira:

      "modules/base/cloud/manifests/identity_store/specs/env.yaml"
    ]
  },
  "repository": {
    "id": 5860316,
    "name": "puppet",
    "url": "https://github.com/CloudCom/puppet",
    "description": "puppet",
    "watchers": 1,
    "stargazers": 1,
    "forks": 2,
    "fork": false,
    "size": 41428,
    "owner": {
      "name": "CloudCom",
      "email": null
    },
    "private": true,
    "open_issues": 0,
    "has_issues": true,
    "has_downloads": true,
    "has_wiki": true,
    "language": "Puppet",
    "created_at": 1347990194,
    "pushed_at": 1394661303,
    "master_branch": "master",

{code}
{panel}
{panel:title=Response [200]}
{code}
Cache-Control: "no-cache, no-store, no-transform"
Connection: "keep-alive"
Content-Length: "0"
Content-Type: "application/xml;charset=UTF-8"
Date: "Wed, 12 Mar 2014 21:55:04 GMT"
Server: "nginx"
Set-Cookie: "atlassian.xsrf.token=BJBC-U4BP-AH96-79EX|bbd9f5db66770edf62e37682b940c83e1e02bceb|lout; Path=/; Secure"

{panel}
You can see the {{INFR-108}} in the request under _commits/message_

In the plugin configuration, you can see the repository is enabled, and JIRA shows it's up to date. (screenshot provided)

Yet when I go to the issue activity for the referenced issue, the commit is not shown. (screenshot provided)
The only activity is when I go in and manually add the github commit URL in the closing comment.
fields.summary: Not picking up github commits with issue keys

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to connect Jira to our internal GitHub enterprise installation and I have come across an "issue", which is stopping me from proceeding.

Our GitHub instance is setup to authenticate via LDAP and the DVCS connector requires GitHub to use OAuth authentication mode to validate the account.

We can't switch the authentication mechanism in GitHub because it will break the tool for the rest of the company.

Please advise.

Regards,

Oliver
fields.summary: Linking Jira with Github Enterprise

fields.description:
Hello.
What version of DVCS Connector
is able to work with JIRA 4.2.1 for GitHub?
Thanks.
fields.summary: Version for Jira 4.2.1

fields.description:
This Atlassian Answers entry describes my problem:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/271053/problems-in-integrating-jira-and-github-using-dvcs-plugin

And this tidbit from Atlassian documentation seems to confirm:

The authorizing account is not necessarily the account that created the key and secret.  The authorizing account should have administrative access on all the repositories to be linked. 

This suggests that in order to link accounts using the DVCS Connector, as a JIRA admin, I also need to have admin rights to the (in this case) GitHub Enterprise repo? If the owner of the repo generates the client id and secret, isn't that supposed to give the DVCS connector the privileges it needs? I was assuming that the "team or user" account is the one that provides the client id and secret. Why does the linking process seem to want to use my GHE account privileges?
fields.summary: Need admin rights to both JIRA *and* to the DVCS repos?

fields.description: After Github OAUTH settings adding Client ID/secret, While trying to connect to github through the DVCS connector in JIRA, I get error as 'Invalid user/team account'. screenshot attached.
fields.summary: While trying to connect to github through the connector in JIRA, I get error as 'Invalid user/team account'

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to add Github Enterprise account with JIRA using DVSC plugin.

Here are the repro setps,

* click on link githug account button on Manage DVCS account page

* hostname choose as Github Enterprise also filled team or user account field

* after provideing all the information clicked on submit button

* Then authorize screen comes and shows my reporitory

* clicked on Authorize app and this page redirect me to my github repository page

* when I go back to Manage DVSC account page, I am not able to find any link overthere.

Regards,

Amit Singh
fields.summary: Not able to add GitHub Enterprise link into JIRA using DVCS plugin

fields.description:
I have configured GHE with an application called 'JIRA', and home page and callback URLs both equal to 'https://atlassian.foo.net:8080/' (Name changed to protect the innocent).  In JIRA in the Add-ons manager, for DVCS Accounts, I click 'Link Bitbucket or GitHub account', enter our GHE URL (https://foogithub.foo.net) and the appropriate credentials. I click 'Add', then 'Continue', then I am sent to a really strange URL:

http://atlassian.slc.foo.net:8080/?error=redirect_uri_mismatch&error
_description=The+redirect_uri+MUST+match+the+registered+callback+URL+for+this+application.&error_uri=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.github.com%2Fv3%2Foauth%2F%23redirect-uri-mismatch

Notice two things about the URL:

1) It's http (not https, as is the URL I entered in GitHub Enterprise)
2) The hostname is also different

If I change the 'http' to 'https' in the browser bar, I get an SSL security warning (as one would expect).

I suspect something is misconfigured in JIRA that it is redirecting to this (broken) URL... but what? Where can I configure that?
fields.summary: JIRA responding with unusual URL for GHE OAuth requests

fields.description: Our projects show "No commits found" despite bitbucket commits with Issue numbers included like [TSTLMCP-118].  How are projects connected with the various common bitbucket repositories used for storing source code?  We used to be able to add repositories to projects but that feature disappeared with bitbucket.
fields.summary: Projects show "No commits found" despite bitbucket commits with Issue numbers included

fields.description:
Attached in the image you can see the result of a smart commit I did to test the DVCS functionality we plan on using.

The top item identifying the change of status seems perfect, but the commit activity is linking to my BitBucket user (ie Alan Smith - smithap) rather than my Jira user (As the one above, with my profile picture) what have I done wrong? The login/email address is the same for both, and it ias managed it for the status update message, but not the commit? How/why?
fields.summary: Issue with Jira, BitBucket and DVCS

fields.description:
Hi,

I followed these direction to setup DVCS Connector between our JIRA Cloud and BitBucket Cloud accounts:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/getting-started-with-bitbucket-and-jira-cloud-692420669.html#notfound

And it appears to be working, but the uptake and processing of smart commit messages takes a very long time. The last one I tried took 38 minutes to show, and I believe I am still waiting longer for my latest test.

I googled around and found this issue with a quote from Megan Cook that reads:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/DCON-379
"If you have webhooks installed, then you should see updates coming through within minutes of the action taking place in GitHub. The periodic syncing that the DVCS Connector does is just a backup measure incase the webhooks fail. If you're seeing updates take longer, please raise a support ticket so we can help troubleshoot your instance."

I checked the BitBucket repository webhooks screen for my repositories and I do not see any webhooks listed, so I think I must be in the same boat as the original reporter of DCON-379. 

Can you advise me on what steps I can take to ensure that smart commit messages are picked up and processed more quickly? Is there any way I can populate the missing webhooks myself? Or should I hang on and stand by for a bug fix?

Love the product line. I just returned from Atlassian Summit 2015 and it was awesome. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: DVCS Connector doesn't appear to setup our webhooks at BitBucket

fields.description:
Need documentation for JIRA Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.12.2-#300 hosted locally to integrate with Bitbucket cloud. We are about to move from our existing SCM to Bitbucket cloud. This integration will make or break the deal.

We do not have plans to upgrade JIRA at this time.

-Baseer
fields.summary: Documentation for JIRA Version: 3.12.2-#300 to Bitbucket cloud

fields.description:
The [links|https://bitbucket.org/dmcintyre/bambob2/admin/links] in Bitbucket don't get updated/removed when adding a new connection with the DVCS connector.

There should be a way, optionally, to remove previous links from the new Jira instance. This is especially useful for users migrating from Jira OnDemand to BTF or from one OnDemand instance to another.
fields.summary: Connecting a Bitbucket account to a new Jira instance should optionally remove the old links

fields.description: I'm more interested in median age of issues than mean age. Even better, I'd like to choose an arbitrary percentile or multiple percentiles to watch in the Average Age Chart. Then I could eliminate outliers from the visual and get a better signal of how responsively we're able to react to incoming issues.
fields.summary: Add median, percentiles to "Average Age Chart" dashboard gadget.

fields.description: The JIRA Subversion plugin and FishEye both show commits in the "All" tab on issues, but the GitHub Connector currently doesn't.
fields.summary: GitHub commit activity should appear in "All" tab on issues
Clean old references from JIRA when upgrading from versions of BBC/GHC without AO

fields.description: Create authenticate session by using  login credential and the fetch json data by using groovy rest client.
fields.summary: Connection establish by using groovy rest api

fields.description:
At the moment the DVCS connector can be configured to invite newly signed up users to the linked Bitbucket team. 

However this can only happen when the user is first created, however as an Admin I'd like to be able to invite users by adding them to a group.
Example: John Smith is now moving to the developer team and is put in the {{developers}} group, a Bitbucket invite should go to this user automatically.
fields.summary: As an Admin I'd like the option to Invite users when added to Certain group

fields.description: It would nice if the Github Commit integration with JIRA Issues showed the module of the commit near the branch name.  When developers post a change to multiple modules, they all show up in the commit history, but it's hard to tell which is which without clicking them open.
fields.summary: Jira Ondemand - Show Repository Name in Commits under Issue//Commits

fields.description:
Feature Request/Suggestion: 

At the moment you press "Start working" the timer starts. At the moment the status is changed, the timer stops. 

If you make a smart commit which changes the status, then the timer would stop at the timestamp of the commit. 

The purpose of this would be for more accurate and automatic time tracking.
fields.summary: Streamline Time Tracking when using SmartCommits

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Nowadays we can only add one oauth key pair to the DVCS connector from BitBucket or GitHub.
It would be great if we could add more than one key pair for connecting multiple accounts.

Thanks
fields.summary: Multiple Oauth authentication

fields.description: When viewing an issue with linked bitbucket changesets, the connector will make many requests to the remote bitbucket service to load user and changeset information.  We should implement a simple caching layer to control the number of requests made.
fields.summary: Bitbucket connector requests details for changesets and users on each page load

fields.description: To support bitbucket staging servers and other bitbucket servers, we should allow for any hostname to be entered for bitbucket repositories.
fields.summary: Allow for any Remote URL for repositories

fields.description:
The Activity Stream in JIRA is at the moment showing information regarding all commit messages.

Users without access to projects mentioned on the Commit Messages still see the messages and are provided links to pages were they don't have access to.

This is a Privacy concern on instances with Restricted Projects.
On instances with a lot of dev activity, this generates unnecessary noise on the Dashboard.

Activity Stream should be restricted to the user visibility according to permissions. Commits from issues without access should be discarded.
fields.summary: Activity Stream in JIRA for Bitbucket/Github commits should only show commits of relevant issues

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Add a new bitbucket account to your JIRA OnDemand instance via the DVCS connector.
# Click on the cog to the right of your new account and view 'configure automatic access'

Result:

Automatic access will be set up and membership to the 'developers' group will be granted

Expected result:

Either no automatic access will be set up, or during the creation process you should be warned that automatic access has been granted.

This is a security concern for users that add people that should have access to the repository to their OD account, as access will be granted unknowingly.

It also becomes more of a problem now that UNIFIED-79 has been released, as it's not at all obvious that membership is granted anymore.
fields.summary: Automatic access added to newly added bitbucket account without notificiation

fields.description:
Issue cloned from https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/GHC-19

From: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/GHC/Clarifications+from+PM

When details for a commit cannot be retrieved from Bitbucket, instead of providing an empty DIV, use these messages:

BitBucket: "Information can't be retrieved from Bitbucket. Please contact your administrator."
GitHub: "Information can't be retrieved from GitHub. Please contact your administrator."
fields.summary: On the issue tab, if unable to retrieve commit data from github/bitbucket show display error message

fields.description:
The "Commits" tab is used to display Github and Bitbucket repository data via the [JIRA DVCS Connector|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin]. The "Source" tab is used to display data from Stash and FishEye.

However currently there are references to FishEye and Stash on the Commit tab in JIRA - which can generate questions. These references should be removed.
!2013-09-09_1812_001.png!
fields.summary: Remove the reference to FishEye and Stash from Commit tab in JIRA

fields.description:
From an admin point of view, it would be convenient to be able to estimate how long the initial sync will take for a given repo; that way, when we're adding a repo for the first time, we can tell our customers how long it might take for JIRA to catch up to Github.

In the absence of that information, our users tend to assume that it's nearly instant.
fields.summary: Calculate or forecast amount of time for repo to be fully sync'd

fields.description:
Most of the tables in this plugin do not have proper indices. This causes  queries on large tables to be slow. Sometimes that slowness causes the DVCS Connector to stop working and affects DCON-338.

We want to add indices to the tables, based on the usage patterns in the code.
fields.summary: Add indexes to tables

fields.description: Please change the (default) name used by the ThreadFactory for the ExecutorService used in the com.atlassian.jira.plugins.bitbucket.mapper.impl.DefaultSynchronizer.DefaultSynchronizer(Bitbucket, BitbucketMapper, ExecutorService, TemplateRenderer). The name currently used by default in [com.atlassian.jira.plugins.bitbucket.DefaultExecutorServiceFactoryBean.DefaultExecutorServiceFactoryBean()|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-bitbucket-connector/src/ff0eab80bdbf/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/bitbucket/DefaultExecutorServiceFactoryBean.java] is "ExecutorServiceThread" which in no way relates them to the Bitbucket/Github connector.
fields.summary: Meaningful name template for the ThreadFactory used by the Synchroniser's ExecutorService

fields.description:
GreenHopper's detail view doesn't cope well displaying the list of files changed within the smaller screen real estate. 

The file names are often too long to be displayed in the space available. Perhaps there is more useful information we could be displaying in this space.

This was raised as a comment on the pull request here:
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-bitbucket-connector/pull-request/68/greenhopper-detail-view-tab-for-commits/diff#comment-76517
fields.summary: Determine better display mechanism for changed files in a commit in GreenHopper

fields.description: With linked Bitbucket or Github repositories the users in the commit messages are not able to be associated with Jira users.  To Jira its like two separate users, even though they are using the same email address.
fields.summary: Link Bitbucket and Github users to Jira users

fields.description:
I don't know if this is currently possible; if so, please tell me how to do it.

We'd like to be able to search within JIRA for specific commits by the commit hash, so that we can see which issues were affected by a given code commit.
fields.summary: Ability to search using Github commit hashes

fields.description:
When smart commits are enabled and new repository is configured such as during an import, all the previous commands are processes resulting in double entries.

Suggestion: only process smart commits for commits that occur after the discovery of the new repository.
fields.summary: Do not process smart commit commands for historical commits when hooking up a new repository

fields.description: When performing a force synchronization, the plugin appears to be crawling the entire commit history for each branch it encounters. This seems unnecessary and could cause excessive calls to the API as well as remote disconnects/timeouts. It should be smarter about when it encounters parents it has already cached and not run duplicate change history.
fields.summary: When (force) synchronizing, don't crawl/cache duplicate commits from branches

fields.description:
Studio Build: JST/Trunk (-r123997)
GitHub Connector  Last commit: 4a9f6ca5823b25768d18 + Private patch for https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/GHC-37  
GitHub Connector  Last commit Date 05/20/2011
Container: https://syd-gs-testing-055.jira.com
fields.summary: On the GitHub Commits issue panel: Display the short commit hash instead of the full hash

fields.description:
At the moment, when there are commits from more than one repo for a single issue, the {{Commits}} tab does not show the source repository.

!dvcs.png!

Since that is the case, it is very difficult to identify which commits come from which repo.  The only way to confirm where the commit is from is by hovering the mouse over the full-commit button and examine the url. 

It would be convenient to organize the list of commits by the repository name, or mention the repository name.

----
The issue is even more pronounced when developer's public personal repos are being watched. Then you will have identical commits (that were accepted from the developer's repo into the mainline) showing up; For such cases, it would be great if Jira allowed filtering of identical commits by specifying an authorative repo to be shown first or exclusively.
fields.summary: Organize the Commits tab by listing the commits according to its repository

fields.description:
From an admin perspective, it'd be nice to be able to collapse or expand the repositories list on the DVCS account page. With large repos, it can get a bit scrolly.

This would also make it easier to vet the list of organizations/repos to make sure all of the appropriate ones have been added.
fields.summary: Collapse or expand feature on DVCS account admin page

fields.description:
It would be nice if we could use the ssh keys that we created in "Shared credentials" in Bamboo instead of having to supply a GitHub username and password.

It's not safe nor convenient for me to save my GitHub user id and password on Bamboo on-demand.  What would be better is if I generated ssh keys and register the public key on GitHub while the public key is stored in in Bamboo on-demand.
fields.summary: Support ssh keys when accessing GitHub via Bamboo

fields.description:
These two are good candidates, in terms of functionality and ease of isolation:

- GitHubCommitsTabPanel.extractDiffInformation(String dif)
- GitHubCommitsTabPanel.parseISO8601(String input)
fields.summary: Add unit tests for some of the most computational methods

fields.description: I think it would be a real value-add to mark comments (in the comment tab) as having originated with Github, and extend that so that when you see such a comment and click on it, it bounces you over to the Commits tab to the actual commit.
fields.summary: Identify comment as originating with Github commit
BitbucketCommunicator.getChangesets escapes while retrieving the details of a ChangeSet due to an unexpected response

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a JIRA issue has multiple pull requests associated with it you should be able to set a trigger, or a validator, so that the issue can't be transitioned until all pull requests are resolved.
 
h3. Workaround

Break up issues into smaller chunks so that each issue is only associated with 1 pull request.
fields.summary: JIRA Trigger for multiple pull requests

fields.description:
The Development section in the JIRA issue screen show the related Commits and the Branch list but it is not possible to browse branch commits from the JIRA Issue itself.

One can click the branch and be redirected but JIRA doesn't provide an embedded browser.
fields.summary: As a QA reviewer I would like branches to be browsable within the JIRA issue

fields.description:
From: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/GHC/Clarifications+from+PM

Something along the lines of "make sure you have the correct oauth settings configured".
fields.summary: When adding or force syncing a repository, error message should suggest the user to check their OAuth settings

fields.description:
Allowing the mapping between JIRA project and BitBucket repository would have the following advantage
* While clicking on "Create Branch" in Development Panel, it will automatically suggest the repository that is linked to the project.
* Remove the list of repositories that the user/team has access to but not linked to JIRA

Else, we could have the communication to be a step smarter with automatically suggest repository during "Create Branch' from the last commit to the project.
fields.summary: Configure Link Between a BitBucket Repository and a JIRA Project

fields.description:
We are noticing that when we introduced Github + JIRA integration, a number of projects had people start making commits before their repositories were actually added and synchronized.

On the initial synchronization, it's our experience that only the actual commit is linked to the issue, and that #hashtag commands are ignored. After that initial sync, of course, everything works as expected.

We realize that there are performance implications; are you considering refactoring the initial sync so that it can interpret #hashtag commands, or is that just prohibitively expensive?
fields.summary: Improve initial sync operations to recognize #hashtag commands

fields.description:
Sometimes issues will be moved between projects. The Commit linked to these issues will no longer be associated to the Issue, as the DVCS connector only checks if the current Issue Key is linked to a changeset.

To improve with moved issues, it should also check the {{moved_issue_key}} table (perhaps on manual resync) and link up the commits to the updated issue key.

This will preserve the full commit history, even if the issue is moved around projects for any reason.
fields.summary: The DVCS connector should check for Moved issues

fields.description:
Pull request synchronization was introduced from 1.4.4.0. Users who upgraded from pre-1.4.4.0 versions will not have the PR Hook configured for their existing repositories. Thus they will not received PR events from BB/GitHub.

PR would still be sync-ed as part of the hourly synchronization. But this could cause a delay of seeing the update on the Development panel for up to one hour.

*Workaround*: unlinking and re-linking the affected repos will install the PR Hook.

Looks like this affects about an estimated of 90% of OnDemand customers, as we only pushed a version containing the PR sync feature in 1.4.15 in January 2014. So only customers who signed up after 1.4.15 was deployed will have the PR webhook setup properly.
fields.summary: Updates of pull requests were received with up to one hour of delay

fields.description:
When the synchronization finishes quickly, there is no progress shown and the sync icon does not spin.

It will be good to still have some visual indication about the sync after clicking on it, so that the user is informed about the fact that the sync has been started.
fields.summary: Synchronisation progress is no longer showing for soft sync

fields.description:
When the DVCS Connector communicates with github.com, it is (I think) able to understand and respect rate limit headers.

Unfortunately, Github Enterprise disables rate limiting, so it's possible for the DVCS Connector to swamp a GHE instance with many, many requests. We have measured periods in which we received 600 requests/second between our JIRA host and our Github Enterprise instance.

Based on a support issue, we've set *jira.devstatus.applink.ratelimit* to 60, but we anecdotally observe that it seems to affect the rate on a per-organization basis. If there are pushes to multiple repositories in several different organizations at about the same time, the request rates will spike again.

We would like to be able to specify that our JIRA host should never exceed _N_ requests per second to our Github Enterprise instance for any reason.
fields.summary: Rate Limiting Connection to Github Enterprise

fields.description:
Issue cloned from https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/GHC-18

From: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/GHC/Clarifications+from+PM

Recommendation: "No commits/changesets found on repository".
fields.summary: Show message when syncing a repo that does not have any commits yet

fields.description: Currently, create branch is only possible for Bitbucket and Stash integration with JIRA but not Github.
fields.summary: Implement 'Create Branch' feature in DVCS connector plugin for Github integration
